content:
From the minutes email I just sent out:

Minutes here. We're really glad this one got recorded, because of these "keepers" noted at the top of the minutes:

View the recording online. Highlights:

  • Pt Contributed Data discussion starts around 4:40.
    • Important distinctions in minutes below, particularly a Zulip thread about "patient writeback" to EHRs, and that the scope of our work (like all of FHIR) is far broader than just EHRs
  • @Dave Hill 's rich, broad PACIO presentation starts at 21:52. (If a virtual meeting could have a standing O, this would have gotten one)

Co-chairs @Virginia Lorenzi and @Debi Willis were unavailable (though Debi dialed in a bit) so @Jan Oldenburg led the meeting while I scribed in between headcold moments.

Do we know if there's an Inferno testing tool from MITRE for the PACIO project? They forked Inferno and made a 'SANER Edition' for the SANER implementation guide. Is PACIO getting the same treatment, with it's own testing harness and certification server?
